id: Apple Says the New iPad Pro Is as Powerful as an Xbox One S
paragraph:
In Apple’s media event held this morning, the tech giant claimed that the new iPad Pro can deliver the same graphics performance as an Xbox One S.During this event, which can be seen in its entirety here, Apple said the new iPad Pro can match this graphics performance in a product that’s 94% smaller without the need of an AC cord. It also claimed it’s faster than 92% of all portable PCs sold in the last month, and that its graphics performance is 1000x faster than the first generation iPad.

 We won’t have to wait long to know if all of these statistics ring true when the new iPad Pro is released on November 7. Announced this morning, the 11-inch iPad Pro starts at $799, and the 12.9-inch begins at $999, both with optional silver and space gray finishes and multiple memory options. A USB-C port is replacing Apple’s proprietary Lightning port. The device is 5.9 mm thin, includes Face ID, an A12 X Bionic chip and uses the same LCD display that is on the newly released iPhone XR.Apple also announced an update to the Macbook Air, as well as a new Mac Mini that is reportedly the fastest of its kind.Colin Stevens is a news writer for IGN.
